meanings.definition: To cry or scream loudly and harshly.
meanings.sent1: The baby squalled when she dropped her toy.
meanings.sent2: The child squalled in fear when the thunder roared.
meanings.sent3: The parrot squalled along with the sirens outside.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock squalled, waking me up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The cat squalled in protest as it was put in the bath.

meanings.definition: A sudden, violent gust of wind.
meanings.sent1: The squalled blew off my hat as I walked by the beach.
meanings.sent2: We had to hold onto our hats during the fierce squalled.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected squalled scattered the leaves all around.
meanings.sent4: The squalled howled through the trees, making them sway.
meanings.sent5: The powerful squalled knocked over the trash cans in the alley.
